docs.summary: Manage Contact Extended Fields

permissions.name: Manage Members and Contacts - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Contacts and Members data, including labels, extended fields and form submissions. This permission scope contains all of the Contacts, Members and CRM permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

docs.summary:
Deletes an extended field.

When an extended field is deleted,
any contact data stored in the field is permanently deleted as well.

permissions.name: Manage Members and Contacts - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Contacts and Members data, including labels, extended fields and form submissions. This permission scope contains all of the Contacts, Members and CRM permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: displayName
params.doc:
Display name to find or create.

 If an existing custom field is an exact match
 for the specified `displayName`,
 the existing field is returned.
 If not, a new field is created and returned.

params.name: dataType
params.doc:
Type of data the field holds.
Ignored if an existing field is an exact match
for the specified display name.

- `TEXT`: Accepts strings.
- `NUMBER`: Accepts floats.
- `DATE`: Accepts dates formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `URL`: Accepts strings. Prepends `https://` if no protocol is included.

ret.doc: Extended field that was found or created.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a custom field with a given name, or creates one if it doesn't exist.

Successful calls to this endpoint always return a field,
which can be passed to subsequent requests.

To find an existing custom field without potentially creating a new one, use
[Get Extended Field](https:dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields/get-extended-field) or
[List Extended Fields](https:dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields/list-extended-fields).

permissions.name: Manage Members and Contacts - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Contacts and Members data, including labels, extended fields and form submissions. This permission scope contains all of the Contacts, Members and CRM permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: key
params.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

docs.summary: Retrieves an extended field.

permissions.name: Manage Members and Contacts - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Contacts and Members data, including labels, extended fields and form submissions. This permission scope contains all of the Contacts, Members and CRM permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: fieldType
params.doc: Filter for fields of the specified type.

params.name: namespace
params.doc:
Filter for fields in the specified namespace.
 Fields created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps
 are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

params.name: startsWith
params.doc: Filter for fields where `displayName` starts with the specified case-sensitive string.

params.name: sort.fieldName
params.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

params.name: sort.order
params.doc:
Sort order. Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order.

Defaults to `ASC`.

params.name: paging.limit
params.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `100`.

params.name: paging.offset
params.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

docs.summary: Retrieves a list of extended fields.

permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

docs.summary:
Retrieves a list of extended fields.

For a detailed list of supported operations, see [sorting and filtering for extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/contacts/extended-fields/sort-and-filter). To learn more about query language, see
[API Query Language](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/getting-started/api-query-language).

permissions.name: Manage Members and Contacts - all permissions
permissions.description: Request permission to read, create and modify the site's Wix Contacts and Members data, including labels, extended fields and form submissions. This permission scope contains all of the Contacts, Members and CRM permissions.

permissions.name: Manage Contact Extended Fields
permissions.description: Request permission to read and modify the extended fields saved to site contacts.

params.name: field.key
params.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field data is available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.notes",
the value can be accessed at `extendedFields["custom.notes"]`.

`key` is generated when the extended field is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

docs.summary: Updates an extended field's specified properties.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_ExtendedFieldUpdatedDomainEvent
messages.displayName: Extended Field Updated Domain Event Object

members.name: id
members.doc: Unique event ID.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Expected `wix.contacts.v4.extended_field`.
Fully Qualified Domain Name.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
Expected `updated`.
Event name.

members.name: updatedEvent
members.doc: Event Info

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ExtendedField ID associated with this event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc: Whether this event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application (e.g., GDPR).

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_ExtendedFieldEntityDeletedEvent
messages.displayName: Extended Field Entity Deleted Event Object

docs.summary: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
Extended field namespace.

Extended fields created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps
are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field data is available at `extendedFields[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.notes",
the value can be accessed at `extendedFields["custom.notes"]`.

`key` is generated when the extended field is created
and cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

members.name: displayName
members.doc: Display name shown in the Contact List.

members.name: dataType
members.doc:
Type of data the field holds.

- `TEXT`: Accepts strings.
- `NUMBER`: Accepts floats.
- `DATE`: Accepts dates formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `URL`: Accepts strings. Prepends `https://` if no protocol is included.

members.name: fieldType
members.doc:
Indicates whether the extended field is a system field or custom field.

- `SYSTEM`: The field is a system field managed by Wix. System fields cannot be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.
- `USER_DEFINED`: The field is a custom field and can be modified by 3rd-party apps or site contributors.

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the field was created.

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the field was last updated.

members.name: description
members.doc: Field description, if the field is a system field.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to return.

 Defaults to `100`.

members.name: offset
members.doc:
Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

 Defaults to `0`.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Requested offset.

members.name: total
members.doc: Number of items that matched the query.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc:
Indicates if `total` calculation timed out before the response was sent.
 Typically this happens if there is a large set of results.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc:
Sort order. Use `ASC` for ascending order or `DESC` for descending order.

Defaults to `ASC`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sorting options. Currently supports sorting on one field only.

Example: `{ "sort": [{"fieldName": "displayName", "order": "DESC"}] }`

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pagination options.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_FindOrCreateExtendedFieldRequest
messages.displayName: Find Or Create Extended Field Request Object

docs.summary: Custom field to find or create.

members.name: displayName
members.doc:
Display name to find or create.

 If an existing custom field is an exact match
 for the specified `displayName`,
 the existing field is returned.
 If not, a new field is created and returned.

members.name: dataType
members.doc:
Type of data the field holds.
Ignored if an existing field is an exact match
for the specified display name.

- `TEXT`: Accepts strings.
- `NUMBER`: Accepts floats.
- `DATE`: Accepts dates formatted as `YYYY-MM-DD`.
- `URL`: Accepts strings. Prepends `https://` if no protocol is included.

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_FindOrCreateExtendedFieldResponse
messages.displayName: Find Or Create Extended Field Response Object

docs.summary: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: field
members.doc: Extended field that was found or created.

members.name: newField
members.doc:
Indicates whether the extended field was just created or already existed.

 If the field was just created, returns `true`.
 If it already existed, returns `false`.

members.name: field
members.doc: Field to update.

docs.summary: Updated extended field.

members.name: field
members.doc: Updated extended field.

members.name: key
members.doc: Extended field key.

docs.summary: Extended field filter options.

members.name: fieldType
members.doc: Filter for fields of the specified type.

members.name: namespace
members.doc:
Filter for fields in the specified namespace.
 Fields created by site contributors or 3rd-party apps
 are automatically assigned to the `custom` namespace.

members.name: startsWith
members.doc: Filter for fields where `displayName` starts with the specified case-sensitive string.

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sorting options.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Paging options.

docs.summary: List of extended fields.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of extended fields.

members.name: metadata
members.doc: Metadata for the page of results.

members.name: key
members.doc:
Extended field key.

When accessing contact data,
extended field values are available at `info.extendedFields.items[key]`.
For example, if the key is "custom.patronus",
the value can be accessed at `info.extendedFields.items["custom.patronus"]`.

Once set, `key` cannot be modified, even if `displayName` changes.

docs.summary: The specified field.

members.name: field
members.doc: The specified field.

messages.displayName: Get Extended Field By Legacy Id Request Object

messages.name: _com_wixpress_contacts_fields_v4_GetExtendedFieldByLegacyIdResponse
messages.displayName: Get Extended Field By Legacy Id Response Object

members.name: query
members.doc: Query options.

members.name: fields
members.doc: List of extended fields.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Details on the paged set of results returned.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN_DATA_TYPE
  • TEXT
  • NUMBER
  • DATE
  • URL

Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • SYSTEM
  • USER_DEFINED

Possible values are:
  • ASC
  • DESC
